items.description: Bounding Box Helper: Visualizes an object's bounding box. Useful for checking size and position. (Also in Snippet Drawer)
Vertex Normals Helper: Shows the vertex normals on a mesh. Essential for debugging lighting. (Also in Snippet Drawer)
Global Wireframe Override: Toggles a wireframe view for the entire scene. Helps isolate geometry vs. material issues. (Also in Snippet Drawer)
Keypress Debug Logger: Press Shift+I to log all debug info at once (add after init function)
Log Camera Position: Useful for finding good viewpoints
Log Object Count: Check for memory leaks
Log Geometry Info: Check vertex count
Log Renderer Info: Monitor performance (draw calls, triangles)
Log Material Properties: Debug visual issues
Texture Loading with Error Handler: Handle failed texture loads with fallback color
Model Loading with Error Handler: Handle failed model loads with placeholder geometry
Container Element: Official examples use document.getElementById('container'). Our IDE needs document.body instead.
Stats Panel: Replace container references with document.body
Asset Paths: Use /models/ or /images/ folders. Upload assets via your file system.
DRACO Decoder Path: three.js.org uses 'jsm/libs/draco/'. Use CDN instead - fully supported!
Window Resize: Official examples use window.onresize. Better to use addEventListener for compatibility.
Import Statements: External Skypack/unpkg URLs work automatically! Our IDE converts them to bundled packages.
Missing PI Constants: Some examples use PI or PI2 in shaders. Add these constants if you see 'undefined' errors.
